result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah E Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremiah E Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Jeremiah E Johnson.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense has not received  discovery or  offer from the State and request an adjournment.
State will follow up. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah E Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Jeremiah E Johnson.  Prosecuting Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a status of counsel. Attorney Steinle has been retained.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge K. Ashley. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed by Attorney Michael J. Steinle.

Adjustment Number: 22A 086875,
Payable Number: 1031517,
Receipt Number: 22RP036502,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant not in court, in custody at HOC. Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah E Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Arthur M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $10,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.

Defendant Jeremiah E Johnson in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Jeremiah E Johnson in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremiah E Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
